website_summaries.verdict: They cost a little less than other high-end options, but these gloves certainly don't cut any corners when it comes to quality or efficacy.
pros: Great compression that doesn't restrict movement
Minimalistic smart seam stitching is less likely to cause irritation, especially when hands are swollen
Designed to naturally retain body heat, offering soothing warmth for aching joints
cons: No extra large option for bigger hands
Some reports of loose threads and premature fraying at the edges of finger and wrist openings

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Second day wearing it and already torn. Not a good product
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: They seem to run small
customer_reviews.text: The quality, color and appearance look to be the same as the IMAK, which I've bought from Walgreens a couple times, but they seem to run small compared to them. I ordered small, but they were so tight I couldn't wear them for more than a few seconds. Next, I ordered a large and they're minimal, if any, bigger, so I can only wear them for a minute or two before my fingertips start changing color. Or course, not thinking ahead I tossed the box after opening them, so now I have 2 pair of gloves I can't wear. Oh well, at least they're weren't expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P.

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. No help whatsoever. More pain wearing these than nothing at all. Would recommend Doctor Developed Copper Arthritis Gloves. Received these after and they feel great. Helps with the pain
customer_reviews.author: Andras S.

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss quality. The seams unravel
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered 3 pairs. One is perfect and I use them nightly. The seams came loose at the finger tips of the next pair. The thumb of the final pair basically came off after one wear. I only sleep in the gloves. There’s no reason the thumb should come off.
customer_reviews.author: D Lind

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: These fell apart a few weeks after wearing them. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: FlamingoLady

customer_reviews.title: Seller was great. Delivery was quick
customer_reviews.text: Seller was great. Delivery was quick. I own a few pair of these, they're very helpful. The only drawback is that I have very large joints and often the stitching breaks in the same spots on each of the pairs. The elasticity is durable, I use my hands for doing a lot of activity daily, and I've gotten some of these tattered because of consistent usage, but they've still held up fairly well. If there was a better glove... but these are fine, function appropriately, and have lasted me awhile. If I would recommend these, I would suggest to buy 2 or more pairs, just to switch around and help them last longer.
customer_reviews.author: xakk15

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality,worn twice to bed and started coming apart. Buy Imak gloves,much better quality!
customer_reviews.author: Richie

customer_reviews.title: For me to read the whole thing!
customer_reviews.text: I Loved them,my Wife not so Happy I got the Wrong size. It was my Fault I didn't read the ad so I didn't know that there were other sizes so I just got the one that was advertised and order 2 pair. Me Personally I think they are Great, I have arthritis in my fingers so they help A lot. My Wife has Carpal tunnel. She said that they helped A little bit,but if I would have gotten her A medium size I'm sure that they would have Helped her OUT. So I just have to wait until I can afford to buy them. But my GLOVES WORK GREAT 👍
customer_reviews.author: Richard Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Not helpful for thumbs..at least mine!
customer_reviews.text: I had a trapeziectomy due to arthritis in the base of my left thumb. Since then I have had bouts of tendonitis with a feeling of joint instability. I thought these gloves would lend some support, but just not the right thing. I can imagine it being helpful for arthritic fingers, but the fabric around the thumb is not taught enough as compared to the compression in the fingers. My right thumb joint is also affected by arthritis and the gloves did not support it either. From a quality standpoint, I'm not sure how long they would last because one of the seams arises mis-sewn.
customer_reviews.author: D.C.M.

customer_reviews.title: good but quality is slipping
customer_reviews.text: I only have arthritis in the lefthand so I use the left glove first then turn the right one inside out and go on for awhile.. recently one of the gloves in each pack has stitching coming out or in some cases it never connected the two pieces. would have returned them but I buy ahead and have no idea which order there from.. Am considering switching to another brand that although more expensive didn't seem to have the same issues. As a whole they keep the joint warm and flexible and are needed more as the time nears for a cortisone shot.
customer_reviews.author: D. Steelquist

customer_reviews.title: Did not help with the pain
customer_reviews.text: This Vive Arthritis Gloves was rated very high for pain in your hands. But I would have to disagree. It was like wearing nothing I was very disappointed. I became sick and had to take treatments for six months, and still taking treatments for health issues, but that has nothing to do with this e-mail, at the time I was not even thinking about this and doing something about because of my health issues. I love amazon since I have spent thousand of dollars over the several years. I request a refund or credit on this item. Thank you in Advance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but it needs better compression overall.
customer_reviews.text: Nice gloves, but I had to return them because they didn't have enough compression where I needed it most, which is the top of my hands. They were also quite loose in the wrist, but one could easily fix that with a small tuck and hem. The finger compression was good, but it was much tighter than the rest of the glove, and the fingers were quite long, which would be a problem for people with shorter fingers. I gave the product 3 stars because overall, it was a good product, it just didn't work out for me. They seemed to be well made, and I noticed no problems with the seams, which is a common complaint, I've noticed.
customer_reviews.author: Angela H.

customer_reviews.title: SAME VENDOR, JUST CHEAPER
customer_reviews.text: THESE ARE THE SAME GLOVES AS Dr. Frederick's Original Arthritis Gloves -... EXCEPT $5 CHEAPER. I BOUGHT THEM BOTH AT THE SAME TIME AND THEY ARE IDENTICAL EXCEPT FOR LABEL.
customer_reviews.author: R. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Still not a perfect fit but helps ease pain
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my mom who has been having excruciating pain in her hands from arthritis. She hasn't found anything else that helps ease the pain and even the Tylenol she takes for arthritis isn't helping as much anymore. We first bought a large because she wears large gloves but they were too big. We bought the medium and they're still not snug but she says they help big time and hasn't taken them off since. As long as they help I'm happy. 4 stars since they aren't as snug as suggested. The finger lengths are a bit long too.
customer_reviews.author: FaerieTxn

customer_reviews.title: Put them on inside out
customer_reviews.text: I bought these primarily to help keep my hands warm while at work - I needed something I could type in. They're thin enough to not prevent me from working and only slow my typing down a bit. A lot of folks have complained about the stitching not holding up, mine are doing fine after putting them on about a hundred times, so I guess you win some and lose some in that regard. My advice though: put them on inside-out. With the stitching facing out I find them much more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Hazlett

customer_reviews.title: There's better- but you pay more! Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: 4 star overall for quality & comfort. 5 stars for value. One will likely pay a lot more for minimal improvements. Fingers are perhaps a bit long to fully expose fingertips- just pull it back a bit if you have shorter fingers like I do. But they accommodated my larger than normal palms comfortably so no complaints. Good stretch. Not thick but warm enough. Worked well typing. After trying several brands this was my value choice. If you want better quality/performance I recommend "Bangbreak copper arthritus compression gloves" for $22.
customer_reviews.author: Sj Construction

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: These have made such a difference. I've got arthritis pretty bad in my hands and have lots of pain and joint swelling. I work on the computer daily and my hands/joints are screaming my the end of the day. Wore them to work in but they slow me down a little. Better to wear them at night. First time I wore them, I woke up the next day with NO joint pain in my hands! Truth. ZERO joint pain in my hands. They haven't NOT hurt in so long I can't even remember the last time. I'll be recommending them to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: DaraLynn

customer_reviews.title: Paper cut proof just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for delivering mail. They are great at protecting hands from cold mail boxes and paper cuts. Paper cut proof! Just enough finger tip opening. I have had no issues with quality. On my 2nd pair only bc my first one looked dingy from 2 years of use (even after washing). I dont dry them. Lay them out to dry. They are very tough but also thin enough you can feel. Not bulky. Also they are snug. My wrist does feel better after wearing all day to work in versus not wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Super Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These gloves give a bit of compression and still allow your fingertips free for fine work. It is kind of like immersing your ...
customer_reviews.text: I do lots of knitting, crochet, and quilting. My hands tend to get a little bit stiff towards the end of the day. These gloves give a bit of compression and still allow your fingertips free for fine work. It is kind of like immersing your hands in warm water to get the motion back. A bit of relief goes a long way to continue my work. The fingers were a tad bit long (I just cut them down to that first joint) but I also have very small hands. The fabric is tightly woven and there is no worry about them becoming unraveled. Good product to have on hand (pun intended :))
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Rhaeyn

customer_reviews.title: “Great seller and wonderful product. My hands and wrists are the worst ...
customer_reviews.text: “This is the second pair of these gloves I ordered recently....I LOVE them. On my first order, I did contact the seller because my hands are small and the gloves were a large. The seller was grest - all I had to do was return them with a label she sent me and then I was able to get the size small I needed. These gloves help my hands and wrists (I have rheumatoid arthritis.) I even wear them to bed!”
customer_reviews.author: Lazarai

customer_reviews.title: Fist Fit Fits?  Nope
customer_reviews.text: Read reviews beforehand (HA) so I knew to measure before I ordered, and got the Large size. The whole construct is awkward, and I wonder if the model's fingers can actually spread more than 1/8th of an inch apart. Stitching around the fingers was sturdy, stitching at the wrist was not. Best to wait for these to be on sale, if you need your knuckles squeezed.
customer_reviews.author: tinadrawsstuff

customer_reviews.title: Make me itch...
customer_reviews.text: Was going to return them because they make me itch... I only paid $9.99 to purchase them but would have to pay $5.99 to return them...guess I am stuck with 2 pair! Large is as big as they come and they are a bit snug... I bought them to wear when I look knit but the fabric and my yarn seem to stick together...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dad says they help
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these for my dad. He is 82 years old, has some neuropathy from some very strong chemo a couple years ago, and has arthritis. But he loves working on knives and guns, building furniture, machining parts, etc. His hands were hurting too bad for him to enjoy these things. He says these gloves give him more relief than anything he's tried. I bought him a second pair. (He can't take prescription arthritis meds due to earlier kidney problems.)
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader in Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably good for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Compression works great, however the length of the fingers (not the thumb) vary from the depiction shown, and in fact the pinkie finger shouldn't technically be considered fingerless. I cut them down and they work fine now, but of course I won't get as much use as they will now start to fray. All in all, I'd give 5 stars for the compression and how that helps my arthritis, minus a star for the overlong "fingerless" fingers and minus a second star for the now decreased durability to make them fit.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Turner

customer_reviews.title: Gloves for tendonitis
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate very much to receive the gloves within a very short time. Well packaged.Reasons for rating of 4 is that seller offered Large size of gloves as the largest size of their product. I tried the glove which fit very tight, and this caused pain in all my hand fingers. I needed to remove the glove (in this case my right and has tendonitis mainly in my index finger) and I will not use it any longer. Seller should offer an XL size gloves to customers. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. Lisboa

customer_reviews.title: Work Well
customer_reviews.text: I like the gloves very much. They are comfortable and easy to get on and off. The compression is just right for my hands and I can wear them for long periods of time without having to take them off. The only drawback, for me, is that during warmer weather the become too hot to wear so I can only use the for long stretches during cold weather. Other than that, I really like them! And I love that they come higher up the wrist/arm than most others!
customer_reviews.author: S. M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best Gloves For Arthritis!!
customer_reviews.text: I use these because I am starting to get arthritis in my hands and do a lot of mouse work on my computer at work. I am actually only using the right one now, but will most likely wear both at some point. My mother-in-law wears these as she has RA and raved about them, so I had to get a pair. They really do help with almost all the pain, although I do also take Tylenol. I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: BettePage

customer_reviews.title: They came apart at the seam the very first time I put them on
customer_reviews.text: This product is junk!!! The first time I put the left glove on the seam came apart about an inch long, the second time the left came apart in another spot and the right glove also came apart. I ordered the L/XL for men and I have normal to small hands for a man. I would not buy this brand again, I am returning them and I just got them on 12/30.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Brown

customer_reviews.title: and comfortable. Well made and the cuff fits about 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the large size. Actual color is a light brown with a hint of gray. The fit is snug, and comfortable. Well made and the cuff fits about 2 inches beyond the thumb joint. My only slight negative is that the finger length is longer than the picture shows and goes beyond the last finger joint about 1/4". But I'm still able to type and use touch keys. There are no external labels/tags.
customer_reviews.author: NC Big Mike

customer_reviews.title: Compression Gloves
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are much more comfortable than I anticipated and work nicely. This is my second pair of Vive Arthritis Gloves. When I bought a new car, the steering wheel was much smaller than what I was used to using. The tighter grip caused my arthritis to worsen to the point where I could not make a fist. After a week or two of wearing the gloves, my hands are pretty much back to normal. I bought the second pair just to have a spare.
customer_reviews.author: B Mayers

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: I bought these compression gloves for my mother who has arthritis as well a Raynaud's. She wakes up with stiff, swollen hands as well as joint pain. She's consistently used these gloves for about a week now and she has noticed a significant difference. She wears them nightly and her hands are not nearly as swollen or painful in the mornings. She also uses them throughout the day and has noticed her grip being better and better hand movement. These gloves are worth a shot for anyone suffering with similar problems.
customer_reviews.author: Briane Johnson

customer_reviews.title: good lil' glove
customer_reviews.text: i bought these arthritis gloves for relief while crocheting. here's the brief the results from me: good compression, finger touch screen, relief from swollen joints from crocheting for too long. i found them to be a little thick & cumbersome when grabbing my yarn & holding my hook. all in all a good glove. would recommend. suggest you size up because of the tight fit. i would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Straw

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Can’t comment about the gloves other than the stitching around the finger tips started unraveling after two days.
customer_reviews.author: lovesamazon

customer_reviews.title: I like these gloves a lot and that is why I ...
customer_reviews.text: I like these gloves a lot and that is why I have about 10 pairs. They're affordable, look awesome and feel great for compression issues. The only downside is the XL version of these (that fit my hands) instantly rip on the bottom portion (next to the tag area) the first time I put them on (happened on all 10 pairs) and after a few months and a few washes they start to come apart with holes etc - but even then I like the way they look :)
customer_reviews.author: shagen454

customer_reviews.title: Cool and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves to reduce fatigue and discomfort while biking I find them to be very comfortable and surprisingly cool in hot weather conditions The open fingertips are convenient for working my cell while riding I wear a large and they fit well but I think the compression could be better I think downsizing to a medium for better compression would be too tight a fit I do recommend them and feel that the gloves will give some degree of support during activities
customer_reviews.author: Redux

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I had surgery and needed to have compression to help with swelling. Before these, I was wrapping fingers individually which worked fine but with these gloves, washing getting dresses, normal use of your hands are soooo much easier. Pull them off when you have to wash and put right back on. Less bulky but still provide great compression. I now have 3 pair - I have one specifically for nighttime since I have dogs and prefer to not take extra dog hairs to bed. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Bamagirl

customer_reviews.title: Quality material and well made gloves
customer_reviews.text: Nice material, very soft and stretchy. Large is really large and the fingers just leave the very top of the fingers clear. I bought this for friend not realizing she had short fingers. I ‘m sorry they didn’t work for her. I will use them but not as compression gloves because they are a bit large for me. Make sure you measure before using and if borderline order down.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzybe

customer_reviews.title: Rough stitching
customer_reviews.text: The stitching at the end of the fingers feels like wire. Once I cut that off, they're comfortable. I'm sure they'll unravel now, but that's better than the thread they used to keep them from unravelling. I don't know what the copper fad is all about, but there's no way I'd pay more for it. It serves no purpose past the addition of woo.
customer_reviews.author: NLS

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: They do help, compared to other brands they are about the same except they thumb is super short and fits weird, I need it longer for the thumb part it doesn’t cover the knuckle where I experience arthritis pain. The pinky is super long so I guess the proportions are off a bit. They feel pretty good as far as compression and material I just don’t like the fit.
customer_reviews.author: JanLynn

customer_reviews.title: Mild Support
customer_reviews.text: I have several wrist and thumb supports. I needed one to to cover finger joints. These gloves fit that need at a good price. Helps with finger joint pain. Easy on but hard to get off. Palm area slippery when trying to handle items like jar coves. Nice feeling when on.
customer_reviews.author: Age At Home

customer_reviews.title: Compression is good & feels soft
customer_reviews.text: I wear these all the time, and sometimes I go out of the house & forget I have them on. fairly comfortable and seems to make my hands less sore after use. The only down side of these gloves in particular is it does leave "seam line" marks on my hand after wearing & if the seams were in a different location maybe that would be better. Overall they are useful
customer_reviews.author: Gibby

customer_reviews.title: No compression for the wrist
customer_reviews.text: These help keep swelling down in my finger joints while crafting. I wish the wrists were tighter though. The compression is best from my second finger joints down to the base of my thumb. I'll keep these because they do help some, but I hope to replace them with gloves that help my wrist too.
customer_reviews.author: Tolana

customer_reviews.title: My original review was terrible because we had received an empty box
customer_reviews.text: My original review was terrible because we had received an empty box, but I wish to now change that review. We reported our problem and the very next day I received a great pair of compression gloves that have been a great relief of pain for my husband. I would highly recommend this company and product.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Anne

customer_reviews.title: Big hands? Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Too tight even at exactly large 9” knuckle sizes folks. My hands straight up went numb while sleeping, I freaked out. Way beyond normal compression. If you have very large hands at 9inch measurements on the knuckle area look elsewhere. My wife wore em and she had way smaller hands and said even the large was tight around the middle area of the hand, which doesn’t make sense.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Diaz-Suarez

customer_reviews.title: Even fit my unfittable hands
customer_reviews.text: “I got my gloves and already my hands hurt less. I was worried about fit as I have huge palms, and short stubby fingers, I got large cause I needed that size for my hands/wrists and was worried they'd be way too long on my fingers. Luckily they are just a little longer than I would like but I still have fingertips for mouse/screen use. So happy they came quickly.”
customer_reviews.author: L. Davis

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING for Artists!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are AMAZING. I’ve only wore them a couple of time but, they have worked wonders. I am an artist and this year after receiving some harsh news about the state of my hands I didn’t think I would be able to paint again for long periods of time. I max out at 10 minutes until my hands are in immense pain. I got these gloves yesterday and today I tried them while painting. My max of 10 minutes went to 50 and I’m sure I couldv’e gone longer. You can imagine my excitement in finding a product like this.
customer_reviews.author: Alana

customer_reviews.title: Love the Gloves but hate the inside seams around the thumbs
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Medium and they were mildly too tight, so I ordered the large size which fit better. But, my problem with these gloves is the seams that run around the thumbs were too tight around the thumb in both sizes. This tightness has aggravated the tendons in the crook of my thumbs even in the large size. Other than this, I love the gloves. But I can't wear them as long as the seam around the thumbs keeps chaffing.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small, measure down sides of your hand
customer_reviews.text: To clarify: I like these. I normally wear small size gloves. My roommate ordered an XL size after carefully measuring 5 inches per the instructions, and these did not fit him even when stretched to the max.. When you measure your palm, wrap the measuring tape down the sides if you have thick hands. The XL just fits me. The gloves are thin and comfortable to type in. The edges are somewhat ragged, not well finished, like loose serger thread. We'll see how these hold up to daily typing.
customer_reviews.author: AuntMary

customer_reviews.title: Good - But Seam Issue
customer_reviews.text: Although these gloves help when I am having a "flare" in my hands, i am disappointed that the seam is coming apart at the thumb joint. They are a good weight and the compression helps. it has been almost a year since I purchased them, however, i don't wear them everyday so I was disappointed to see the seam issue.
customer_reviews.author: paylou

customer_reviews.title: The Work
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised at how well these worked. My hands are often very swollen and painful. So far these have done an excellent job keeping the swelling and pain to a minimum. I'll warn you that they run pretty small. I would have given 5 stars but I wish they were tighter around the wrist area. Very tight on fingers and loose around my wrist.
customer_reviews.author: taelor tidwell

customer_reviews.title: as advertized
customer_reviews.text: these gloves seem to be of high quality...came in the mail today and i immediately put them on...they are very comfortable and easy to put on and take off...the tips of the fingers are exposed so there is no problem with touch screen devices...would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: To small, didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Material feels great.BUT, I got the large size and it is still way too tight. Had to cut the fingers down about inch. Had to cut side seam to get glove on. Made my hands hurt after a few minutes. If these gloves came in a larger size that i wouldn't have to alter, I might have found them useful and could have worn the gloves. I broke my wrist and hand few months ago so i needed some type of compression glove for support. These are not it.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Hill

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Purchasing Another Pair
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my boyfriend who is a full stack web developer and spends the majority of his time typing away at a keyboard. He wears them all the time now and appreciates the support and warmth they provide! He's had them for about a month now and they have been holding up very well- no threads pulled or holes to happen yet. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: jsplatts

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING RELIEF
customer_reviews.text: I found them to be too compressive at first. I soon learn that is natural until my body heat warms the gloves and then increases the elasticity and proper compression. Now I love them as they provide great relief.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Fit awkward. Fingers too long. It actually covered my finger tips. Too tight around base of fingers. No compression just tight. Increased my pain. Fabric not as pictured. Imak far superior. Wasted my money. Ended up buying Imak.
customer_reviews.author: Linny

customer_reviews.title: Dont make your hands sweat
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I work in coolers and freezers with a handheld. They are comfy and keep my hands warm without impinging on my work ability. Have had arthritis gloves before and after wearing a day they would reek. These I have worn for a few days at a time. No smell.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Should take out the title "Heat Hand Gloves for Computer Typing"
customer_reviews.text: I only bought these because my hands are always cold from poor blood circulation. I purchased the large pair for my hands. They are very tight and trying to type on a keyword board is a hassle. When wearing these gloves, I make numerous grammar mistakes because it's too hard to bend any fingers. They do not, I repeat, do not hold heat. I can easily feel a breeze through the material. I thought my circulation would improve and would warm up my fingertips too, but I was wrong. Taking them off is a nuisance because I feel like I'm going to tear them. If you're looking to purchase these for the heating purpose stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice!
customer_reviews.text: I liked these gloves. The compression is light, but feels good. No, it doesn't take away pain completely, but does give a nice squeeze to the hand to help hands feel better. You can also easily access your mobile screens. I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: It can be easy to do without thinking and it will rip the ...
customer_reviews.text: This product has really helped my husband's neuropathy. He wears these for an hour or so at a time and can feel some relief. They aren't miracle gloves, but any amount of pain that can be taken away is a plus in our book! Be careful not to pull the glove by the tag though. It can be easy to do without thinking and it will rip the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Noble

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable pain relief.
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with product. My only compliant is that the seam on the thumb can be a little uncomfortable. It does exactly what I wanted. It provides comfortable compression, but allows for comfortable movement. It provides pain relief to my hand and wrist without limiting my ability to continue with daily activities. I am able to crochet and continue with child care activities without it getting in the way. It doesn’t affect using my phone’s touchscreen or reading on my Kindle. Overall, very happy with with product.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have bought different brands and they all go up in price when i order again. These are reasonable priced and feel snugger then the other brands, which is great. I wear them all the time and just bought 2 more pair. I even wear them to bed sometimes. Gave my sister some she loves them too. Helps with pain in my thumb joints.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Savitz

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: I bought these too relieve my osteoarthritis as nothing works. Unfortunately they didn’t help. It’s a pain to get them on because you need to roll out the fingers . I wish they would refund my monet
customer_reviews.author: thebarbecuemaster

customer_reviews.title: Fabric and seems feel cheap and ready to fail with ...
customer_reviews.text: Fabric and seems feel cheap and ready to fail with any activity beyond the rigors of holding a pen. Sizing is also difficult to manage since in general and according to their provided measurments a Large should fit me well but instead I found circulation restricted. I will be looking for alternatives in larger sizes and also in greater wrist retention, these have a tendency to slide down my wrist to the base of my palm despite the fact that their overly tight along the palm and knuckles.
customer_reviews.author: Gilly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Swollen Hands
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfect for me for therapy after cutting off fingers, which were reattached by a remarkable hand Surgeon. They were wore during sleeping to keep the swelling down. Could be used for Arthritis to, I would assume.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Lyles

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Gloves Help Circulation
customer_reviews.text: I received my gloves as a gift and just love them. My mom was in the hospital and her hands were very cold. I offered to let her wear my gloves. I explained that they would help with circulation. She wore them and was very impressed. My dad wore them the next day, and he loved them as well. Right then I hopped on line and ordered 2 pairs (1 for each of them). They shipped and were received within 2 days. Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: xsnrg

customer_reviews.title: Longer than average fingers - nice!
customer_reviews.text: Of the several different gloves I've tried, the fingers on these can be pulled up close to the end of my fingers more easily, and that's what I need. The fingers could be even a bit longer, but these are the best I've found so far. I prefer to turn them inside out so the seams don't press into sensitive fingers.
customer_reviews.author: jrt

customer_reviews.title: NOT IMPRESSED
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT 2 DIFFERENT PAIR.. THE BIGGER PAIR WAS STILL TO SMALL AND THE SEAMS WERE HARD ON THE FINGERS AN THUMB. NEW SOMEONE ELSE THAT WAS THRILLED WITH THEM AND DECIDED THAT SHE NEEDED THEM MORE THAN I DID.... NOT UP SET BUT AM A BIT BUMMED OUT ABOUT IT THOUGH
customer_reviews.author: FRANCES S LUNYOU

customer_reviews.title: Warm, but too tight
customer_reviews.text: Although these gloves are warm, my hands could only tolerate the tightness for 30 minutes or so. My hands are a 'large' size (not huge or anything, just a standard 'large'). If the gloves came in a size larger, they might work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Mills

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother to measure you hand.
customer_reviews.text: How the hell could I rate these for anything considering I couldn't get them on my hand. Don't bother measuring your hand. We measured mine twice, ordered the large size. I can't even begin to get them on my hand. I could barely get one on my fingers. The box they came in says large. I would need an XXX large.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Compression Gloves
customer_reviews.text: I have Rheumatoid Arthritis and my husband has Osteoarthritis so we both deal with pain and swelling in our hands. We have tried several different brands of gloves from expensive to cheap and I have to say I'm impressed with these. Just the right amount of compression.
customer_reviews.author: D Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Didn't expect much
customer_reviews.text: I have issues with my hands swelling. Sometimes it's so bad I can't even make coffee in the morning. My Dr recommended I get compression gloves and they worked. I wear them when sleeping and in the morning I can mostly do my morning routine. I honestly didn't expect much but they're a god send.
customer_reviews.author: Takorie

customer_reviews.title: Helped my arthritis.
customer_reviews.text: Love these gloves. I wear them at night and by morning my fingers aren’t so tight. Also, I have some numbness and tingling in my fingertips and these gloves seem to help with that. Wash in cold water in the machine and lay flat to dry. I am small boned and bought a size large. They are snug but very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: trafficgal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and compression
customer_reviews.text: I have used these gloves for a very long time and I needed to replace them. They provide just the right amount of compression and are comfortable to wear. I ordered a size larger this time to accommodate additional swelling. They fit perfectly I love them.
customer_reviews.author: ibjbUSA

customer_reviews.title: Some relief at last!
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are well made, flexible and comfortable enough to wear all day and night. The light compression eases the arthritic pain and stiffness in my fingers/hands. Although they could use a little more compression over the wrists for arthritis relief in that location, they were not really described for that, so I will not deduct anything from the rating, but it is a suggestion to consider.
customer_reviews.author: Snoozer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and effective!
customer_reviews.text: I got these because my fingers were getting sore from all the typing I do as an English major in college. They relieve the pain in my joints while being comfortable enough to wear out and about. I’ve had them for seven months now, and all I can say about durability is that there are a couple of loose threads here and there.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Helps keep fingers warm.
customer_reviews.text: The gloves aren't bad and fit well. I have VERY tender fingers which don't open all the way and tingling at the tips. I can feel some pain relief after wearing them all night but I want a miracle cure which is likely expecting too much for 8-9 dollars. I still wear these and they are what is advertised.
customer_reviews.author: T E. H.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Like many others, one of my gloves ripped open at the wrist area on the first day of use. It's a small finger sized hole. Despite that poor quality seamwork, the gloves are still useable and seem to work fairly effectively as far as circulation and less pain go and I use them daily. I would return them for a new pair but I just really don't feel like going through that process over 10 bucks, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Malloy Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit (if you want less compression just order a bigger size), warm and comfortable with open fingertips for use with touchscreen devices. Other gloves have open seams or stitching that can rub and get uncomfortable or fray over time, but so far, no problems with these.
customer_reviews.author: Act162This

customer_reviews.title: Seem pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: Only worn the a few nights but they seem to help. I rub on the cream then put the gloves on to let it sink it and my hands seem a bit warmer and less achy when I wake up. I did order one size up which I'm happy about as I don't want them too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Jenbc23

customer_reviews.title: Really helps
customer_reviews.text: We attended a lecture by a local rheumatologist who recommended these gloves for osteoarthritic hands. Works great. I do turn them wrong side out so the seams don't press into my sore joints.
customer_reviews.author: Annie's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Are your hands cold?
customer_reviews.text: Buy these gloves to wear indoors and out for better health especially if your hands are often chilled by too much air conditioning or if you live in a cold climate.
customer_reviews.author: ART.ST

customer_reviews.title: Excellent help with recovering from hand injury.
customer_reviews.text: I injured my hand and was using the nylon style "copper" compression gloves to help with recovery. They do give support, but the pair I was using started to wear out and I decided to try these. The difference was huge. These give much more support and the amount of compression is significantly higher. For someone who really needs compression on their fingers, these give support on all knuckles. I definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and soothing to arthritic hands.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on, comfortable and soothing for arthritic hands and carpal tunnel syndrome if worn overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: They really work
customer_reviews.text: My sister-in-law bought this for arthritis it seemed to work really good at first but then her arthritis got really severe and it didn't it didn't work so well then.
customer_reviews.author: Linda W. Lonnett

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for arthritic fingers and hand!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these gloves; I purchased these to keep at work. I do a lot typing and these gloves help a lot. I wear them at home and also sleep in these when hands are swollen. These are very nice!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret W

customer_reviews.title: Not just for arthritis
customer_reviews.text: Vive arthritis gloves help with the pain I have from mild arthritis, especially when doing tasks like typing or writing. They are also a great help before my weekly infusion, to "plump up" the veins on the backs of my hands for easier IV access.
customer_reviews.author: Susan S.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: This is my second set still the seams fall apart. I wish the would reinforce the seams. I will not continue to waste my hard earned money. Guess, I'm in search of new gloves again!
customer_reviews.author: loving wife

customer_reviews.title: Fit
customer_reviews.text: Just got them and put them on. They are a large but very tight. Maybe they will loosen as I wear them and a bit long in the fingers, but I have small hands for a man
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bill

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and nice looking. Keeps my constantly cold hands warm and helps with my arthritis. These are my second pair, I can't find my first. But I figured even if I find them, I'd then have two pair to make sure I always have one on hand. Several of my friends have also purchased them for similar reasons. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Helps with the pain
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable I wear them at night when I'm sleeping and they seem to help with the pain
customer_reviews.author: margaret

customer_reviews.title: Yes! They really work!
customer_reviews.text: They really work! I’m a lineman so I work with my hands 12 hours a day and these compression gloves take the pain away. At times I use while I’m working or I put them on after my day has ended an sleep with them.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Antonio Aguilera

customer_reviews.title: Just gloves
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping for these to help with hand pain. They are just fingerless gloves. Disappointed that they were not what I expected but are ok for fingerless gloves. Kept them but wouldn't buy if expecting more
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: “These compression gloves are excellent! I have other compression gloves that stretch out ...
customer_reviews.text: “These compression gloves are excellent! I have other compression gloves that stretch out after 1 day and I have to wet them or wash them to get the compression back, these gloves are thicker and the finger length is longer. They provide much more compression for my arthritic hands. Overall these gloves are an A+!”
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves them!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my husband who has arthritis. He says there is enough pressure to feel good but not too much to make his fingers numb, and just enough to help his hands stay warm. We plan to order more.
customer_reviews.author: donna tester

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit
customer_reviews.text: The gloves are certainly compression gloves. The material is light and breathable and doesnt feel cheap. It does however rip at the seams somewhat easily. It happened to me on day one. Also I didn't realize how much these gloves actually compress it actually hurt my uands after a while.
customer_reviews.author: False Path

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: too small in the fingers but not the wrist with no larger sizes available, not really warm, somewhat constricting... not helpful. would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: Runs a bit small to purchased larger size. Much better but fingers are a bit too long now. Tips still stick out so able to use with touch screen devices.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: the gloves were wonderful I bought them because I work at home and in the winter to save money we keep the temperature down and my hands get cold but I need to use the computer these are wonderful easy to work with
customer_reviews.author: Karen Nunez

customer_reviews.title: Works well for RA
customer_reviews.text: These help with functionality in my hands when they are swollen from Rheumatoid Arthritis. My only problem is there is a seam that irritates mildly if I wear them too long.
customer_reviews.author: R. Page

customer_reviews.title: Love them !!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th set I have bought. I bought a set for my sister and I bought 2 for myself. Out Jack Russell chewed the others. Thank goodness they are a decent price or my hands would suffer. Thank you and these will go in my purse when I don't have them on. And yes, as you can see, I will buy again !!
customer_reviews.author: Robin E. Davidson

product_meta.title: Vive Arthritis Gloves - Men, Women Rheumatoid Compression Hand Glove for Osteoarthritis- Arthritic Joint Pain Relief - Carpal Tunnel Wrist Support - Open Finger, Fingerless Thumb for Computer Typing
feature_bullets: SOOTHING COMPRESSION THERAPY: Embracing the natural shape of each hand, the Vive arthritis gloves are form-fitting, providing therapeutic compression to relieve pain, stiffness and inflammation. The soft compression gloves soothe sore, aching tendons, muscles and joints to effectively relieve arthritis pain by reducing stress on pressure points in the fingers, hands and wrists.

OPEN FINGER DESIGN: Striking the perfect balance between optimal compression support and mobility, the arthritis compression gloves feature an open finger design. The open finger design allows wearers to easily perform everyday tasks, including using electronic devices, typing, cooking, driving and gardening.

BREATHABLE COMFORT BLEND: Constructed with a lightweight, cotton-spandex blend, the fingerless arthritis gloves are breathable for all-day comfort. The blend is also temperature regulating, retaining therapeutic heat to soothe aching joints without feeling hot or stuffy.
DURABLE SMART STITCHING: Recently updated for exceptional durability, the Vive compression gloves feature new smart seam stitching to minimize irritation and pressure points for greater comfort.
VIVE GUARANTEE: 60 day guarantee so you can purchase now with confidence.
